newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: LG Metals says Q1 copper output rises.
newsitem.headline: LG Metals says Q1 copper output rises.

text.p: South Korea's LG Metals Corp, an affiliate of LG Group, said on Friday its copper production rose 6.1 percent to 64,300 tonnes from 60,600 tonnes a year earlier.
LG Metals is South Korea's largest copper smelter and refiner, which also produces gold and silver as by-products.
An LG Metals official said the company's gold output, including production using imported bullion, rose 28.5 percent to 21.2 tonnes in the first quarter of this year from 16.5 tonnes a year ago.
The company's silver output, including production using imported bullion, also rose 18.8 percent to 59.5 tonnes in the first quarter from 50.1 tonnes a year earlier, he said.
In 1996, LG Metals' output totalled 244,500 tonnes of copper, 68.9 tonnes of gold and 218.7 tonnes of silver.
